website_summaries.verdict: The Creative Stage sound bar and subwoofer combo sets the standard for a desktop gaming system on a budget and can even work with small TVs.
pros: The Creative Stage offers more features than other budget sound bars, including HDMI and a separate subwoofer
It plays clearly, and the subwoofer sets it apart from "all-in-one" sound
It's perfectly suited to desktop listening and also performs well with rock or dance music
The onboard display makes it easy to tell which input you're on
cons: It's not as successful as a TV sound bar due to the physical length restrictions of the cabinet, with little stereo separation
It doesn't play as loud as you might want in a living room environment

customer_reviews.title: BIG sound in a small package
customer_reviews.text: We bought this soundbar for a small in home office. I feel like this would be enough for a small livingroom! The subwoofer is super slim, we have it under a desk, and it still sounds great! The soundbar is very capable. Highs are high and lows are low. This system is very easy to hook up. You can probably hook it up to an old tube tv if you wanted to! I can't complain. The remote could be updated though.
customer_reviews.author: Mr&MrsTesterOfAllTheThings

customer_reviews.title: Annoying product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product because it was listed as "Amazon Choice". However, the speaker has a special design, which automatically stops when it cannot detect signal. This is very annoying, because I do not want to have a high sound volume when I am alone. Thus, the speaker stops in every a couple of minutes. You must tune the volume again to retrieve the sound. The supporter webpage provides a firmware to tune this feature off. However, I tried multiple times to install and remove it following the instruction. It never worked. I eventually had to return it. The seller refunded me but the product wasted a lot of my time.
customer_reviews.author: David Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted a whopping 3 months before it died
customer_reviews.text: Was okay untill it stopped working, i turned it on one day and it just didn’t work, just buzzing noise. Tried blowing on the cables and nothing... only lasted a whopping 3 months
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality, not great
customer_reviews.text: For the money, I guess I expected a little more out of this. The bass is extremely underwhelming, almost non-existent. The highs and mids are decent enough. I replaced some 10 dollar USB powered computer speakers for this sound bar, and honestly I should have saved my forty bucks and just kept the 10 dollar speakers.
customer_reviews.author: S. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great value, moderate quality.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so i already own a few creative products and ive always been happy with their quality. For this sound bar and sub however, i was a little disappointed. For example, the sub housing itself has a rattle to it even at medium volume and with mid range sub level. For 80 bucks i wasnt expecting anything crazy, but in terms of quality, i was let down by a brand i knew well. Is it intolerable? No, not really, once i put it in place and i usually only use it for gaming so i barely notice it. For the 80 bucks, invest it in a slightly more expensive model or brand.
customer_reviews.author: Gamer

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother for the computer...
customer_reviews.text: This may be an adequate portable speaker (though it is rather large to use as such, however I guess for small gatherings it would suffice), but it is not as a computer sound bar. Maybe it's just me, but I don't think sound bar's suit computers if you appreciate the sound quality overall. The bass out of this was nominal, at best. Tone was flat...and not the good kind.
customer_reviews.author: asmz_me

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good but getting feedback when plugged into usb.
customer_reviews.text: The speaker sounds great for the price and better than my previous computer speakers. I use these for cruising the internet, listening to music. I think the soundbar looks good. My complaint for the speaker is that I can only turn up the volume on the speaker by maybe 30% of power. Every time I take it louder it gets feedback or the "hissing" sound people are mentioning. I can fix this feedback by unplugging the power cable then it works fine. I tried changing the cable with two different cables and end up with the same feedback. The rest of my cables on the computer are shielded so I am not sure where it is coming from.
customer_reviews.author: Fystol

customer_reviews.title: USed for regular progarm televison sound
customer_reviews.text: I was quite pleased with the sound of the unit for the money. It made a noticeable difference with sound from our television. I found it easy to connect. I comes with an earphone style jack so if you want a better connection you will need to get another cable.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent soundar for PC... While it worked :(
customer_reviews.text: Excellent choice sound bar for PC. USB cable provided doesn't seem to be shielded, there's a lot of static noise if it is connected to the PC for power. Other then that, I'm very happy with it. UPDATE: speaker stopped charging due to a bad USB charging port after over a couple of months of use. Can no longer use it. The charging port feels lose when plugging the USB cable. Speaker was always stationary, never moved. I guess quality is no longer a Creative Labs concern. Shame on you. It was a decent speaker while it worked. Too bad I can not return it or replace it.
customer_reviews.author: T... M...

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Speaker , Great sound , Great price !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this speaker to use as a PC speaker the sound and design were great , But the speaker was turning off after 10 mins of not receiving a signal which was no good for what I wanted. I went to Creatives support page and explained via chat that this was a major annoyance , They emailed me a new firmware which disables the speaker from turning off for 6 hours, All is well as it usually is with Creative !
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Armani

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality at the best price !
customer_reviews.text: I waited for this model release and then bought it. I feel worth buying. Audio quality is excellent at this price. I did not test it in deep, but as far as my knowledge is concerned the below are true: Pros: Audio quality. Design. Size and measurments- very sleek. Bass - Creative is best in this in this price range afaik. Cons: Switching to different modes e.g: bt to au or...you need to manually press the button. I feel good about this product, i really enjoy watching movies now.I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Naresh Kumar Kurnool

customer_reviews.title: If you like Mid-tones, this for you...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I had purchased budget Creative speaker sets in the past. They worked really well, so I figured I would give this soundbar and sub a shot. I was VERY disappointed. I knew going into it that it was not going to be the best, but this sounded like a $15 speaker set, marked up, because it's a "soundbar." The three equalizer settings really have no difference between them. The base isn't that great and has a cheap thump sound. The High are muddy, and the Mids are 80% of the sound. Spend the twenty extra bucks and get a LG or Samsung....
customer_reviews.author: MoMo2049

customer_reviews.title: Died in Less Than a Month
customer_reviews.text: Lasted less than a month. It worked fine initially and the amplifier went bad. Both the Bluetooth feed and the auxiliary input sounded scratchy and unintelligible. The electronic voice that tells you it’s connecting to Bluetooth still sounded fine, so it’s clearly the amplifier. Unfortunately this happened while I was on a business trip so I missed my return window.
customer_reviews.author: George R Wilson III

customer_reviews.title: It's just stuck
customer_reviews.text: So I received this soundbar and as soon as I tried to use it it just got stuck on the blue light (as shown in the picture provided). I have no idea what to do, I have been trying to switch it off by holding the power button down as instructed in the manual provided but nothing. It has been like that for 2 days now and waiting out the batter seems point less. This product is such a waste of money apparently and I wouldn't recommend anyone to buy unless there is a solution to this. Thought Creative made good products but apparently that's something of the past now.
customer_reviews.author: Bassam Buali

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Soundbar
customer_reviews.text: For those looking for no nonsense, simple sound bars, this is it. Zero trouble since getting it. I love its bass. crazy powerful, and actually i had to turn the bass way down from factory just so I would'nt bother neighbors. The one thing I need to figure out is movies and gaming. too potent, and the bass comes through way more than treble, and makes it just like you are feeling/experiencing a rumble box, but im sure thats just my computers settings not jiving with it. With the amazon alexa, its awesome. honestly, no complaints with anything music out of the thing. pretty happy all around.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon Francis

customer_reviews.title: Solid PC soundbar from a solid company
customer_reviews.text: Solid overall product. Works really well if you need sound to fill a small area. I like it for work, as the volume can be low but I get a nice full sound personally and it doesn’t carry through the room. Plus you can plug it out and use it completely wirelessly. I think this would have been great to have in my college dorm. Make sure you update the firmware by downloading it from their website. Fixes issues with a very short inactivity shutdown time.
customer_reviews.author: 3-Wheel Khalil

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am pleasantly surprised with this purchase, especially for the price. I bought the sound bar (with sub-woofer) to replace a Samsung sound bar paired with a Samsung TV. The Samsung soundbar never did turn on with the TV (connected through ARC), this one works flawlessly. The bass unit seems to kick in when I'm listening to music and subsides when it's just voice. The sound quality is head and shoulders above the Samsung bar. I'd definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Mark R.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome set up for a desktop computer
customer_reviews.text: This thing sounds excellent and fits perfectly below my 40" monitor. Music, games, and movies all come through with deep powerful sound. This is easily worth $50 more than what Amazon is selling it for. Grab it now! Only negative is the source display right in the middle of the soundbar is a bright white LED that can be distracting after a while. It should turn off after a few seconds of displaying and only activate if you press one of the buttons or change the source.
customer_reviews.author: JPG

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound with Plenty of Bass !!!
customer_reviews.text: This soundbar and woofer work great ,very good deep rich bass , easy to hook up , I am using this soundbar on an older HP 6000 desktop computer and it works flawlessly !!! Music on youtube and amazon sounds great !!! The price was very affordable too , under 100 dollars including the sales tax . I would recommend this soundbar to anyone looking to enrich the sound coming from their computer !!!
customer_reviews.author: ralph carter

customer_reviews.title: Consumer Reports winning pick!
customer_reviews.text: Had this on my wish list since finding it at the top of Consumer Reports a month back. Best value hands down for $90 !!! I love it for my laptop, though it would work great as a sound bar for your TV. The bass makes this one a legit Winner!
customer_reviews.author: E. Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and features for the price, no complaints.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and features for the price, no complaints. Sure there is better sound out there, but unless you are an outright audiophile you wouldn't notice. This is product is just like a shrunk down version of your TV soundbar and sounds just as good in a smaller package. Personally hated having tons of objects and wires on the desk, this just simplified it all, and it can mount to my monitor mount very simply if I wanted that.
customer_reviews.author: Sportsman1000

customer_reviews.title: Good sound;  big bass
customer_reviews.text: I've long been a fan of Creative speaker systems. I use the Creative Stage with my computer. It has very nice sound from the soundbar & a ton of bass from subwoofer. I actually dialed back the bass for movie watching, as the bass was a bit boomy for that use. The remote is quite useful, since the actual controls are on the edge of the soundbar, which is under my monitor. Set was quick & simple. I went with an optical cable, but I did test it with a AUX cable as well. I'm very happy with the Creative Stage.
customer_reviews.author: GazNá

customer_reviews.title: Thin Sound, Constant Hiss When Plugged In
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few Creative products in the past and loved them, so I really wanted to like this, but the sound is actually pretty anemic for the price and there's a constant hissing from the speaker when the power cable is plugged it. Unfortunately there aren't a lot of other soundbar products like this in the same price range, but if your setup allows for it I'd highly recommend just getting normal computer speakers in the same price range for much better sound.
customer_reviews.author: creaturekyle

customer_reviews.title: Great sound - responsive company
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as sound bar for use with 4k monitor; works fine in intended use. I've also tested the standalone usb-stick mode which works well. Sound quality is very good with a nice deep bass, adequate high end, good separation. Volume max is typical for a computer-oriented soundbar. The included audio cable is short but sufficient to reach from the monitor's output port to the device. Re-rated after a couple of months with the device - it's a solid 5-star investment!
customer_reviews.author: William P. Woodall

customer_reviews.title: If You're On a Budget, Buy This Speaker
customer_reviews.text: This speaker is a great find, it's loud--- which matters when you're competing with outside noises, an AC, your husband's rig, etc--- it's the bass is not muddy but still gives you a nice kick, it's compact and fits well under your monitor and it's stylish. If you're building an expensive gaming PC and think "OMG I forgot speakers!" then look no further. You'll be really happy with them for multimedia consumption and gaming and you don't have to spend a billion dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great compact soundbar with subwoofer
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a small sound bar for my 32" flat screen in my kitchen for a while. This one fit the bill perfectly. It is small enough to sit right under the TV and the subwoofer fit behind it just right. The sound IS a huge improvement over the speakers in the TV and it pushes the sound throughout the entire kitchen and dining area with no trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Cor224

customer_reviews.title: Fair sound and good price.
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a Creative dual speaker with separate woofer. The old stuff sounded great but it died. The Creative Sound Bar provides fair quality sound but the base really isn't there. Which is as expected. This bar provides what I need. I've set it up wired because the bluetooth connection is laggy when game playing. I have no complaints but I miss my deep low freqs of the past. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Culver

customer_reviews.title: Nice speaker bar, good sound.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and use, and provides good sound. Just make sure that, if using for a PC as I am, that you plug the USB into a different source of power than the motherboard, as I did get some RF interference. The interference went away when the power was plugged into an A/C adapter in a wall plug.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Patton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the price with good sound
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is remarkable considering the $40 price tag. Very easy to install. It took me under a minute. Just plug and pair. As you can see by the photo, it fits perfectly under my desktop monitor. The only complaint I have is the buttons are the side lack definition for your fingers to easily identify the up and down volumes and the off button.
customer_reviews.author: PAPete

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good but has only one foot
customer_reviews.text: I like the sound, rich and vibrant. Just won't stay put on my desk. As you can see from the photo, mine was shipped with only one foot. The rubber foot on the lower half is there. The rubber foot on the upper was missing. What happened?
customer_reviews.author: Branson A. Pethel

customer_reviews.title: Not enough cords
customer_reviews.text: Had to go out and buy a cord for $15 as the sound bar has more than one option for connecting it to your tv. The company should have all the cords needs to hook it up and not force the buyer to go out and purchase extra stuff. Or, they could clearly state in the description that there is only one cord and that you might have to buy something else. Of course I firmly believe that if you are seeking a device that has more than one option for connection, then all the cords you might need should be included
customer_reviews.author: mpdague

customer_reviews.title: Great for small LED TV.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with a 24" TV in my office. Fantastic. It is the right size. Hooked up to the USB on the TV it works just fine. These small TVs don't have good speakers so the sound bar or any other speakers is necessary. And the sound quality from Creative Labs is spectacular! I haven't used the Bluetooth or mobile feature so I wont comment about that. You wont find a speaker/sound bar at the same price level that sounds as good. One thing, the on/off/Bluetooth pairing mode button is a little funky. They should have used two different buttons for this.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Works well for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this speaker for my computer and to take around the house. Works well for it's price. Sound isn't the greatest, but works well for it's price. Bass is a little weak. I downloaded the firmware update which extends the auto shutdown time. This is a must IMO if your using it for your computer. My only complaint is the "Power on" voice prompts when you turn the speaker is loud. Wish there was a way to disable or turn it down.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes you get more than what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound quality unlike most inexpensive sound systems. I wasn't in the market for a sound bar but when my daughter wanted to store her 55" tv in my exercise room I wanted to enhance the tv sound so I purchased this inexpensive ( read cheap) sound bar. I was blown away by the sound. room filling and deep bass response not that annoying mid-bass boom you get from most cheaper sound systems. I also love the blue tooth so I can play music w/o turning the tv on. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: James pittman

customer_reviews.title: Good price and fits the job
customer_reviews.text: I was seeking a small sound bar (less than 20 inches wide) that didn’t require an additional sub-woofer box for a TV that will be placed in a small room. This sound bar delivers for me. It doesn’t have thundering bass but I think it delivers good range of sound at the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Avila

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: I use this for both my computer and television. I live in a camper and this works very well I do have to keep the volume down as it can get quite loud. It is slim and elegant and the sound quality is great. I love the remote.
customer_reviews.author: carrollstuff

customer_reviews.title: Vast improvement
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a vast improvement from what I was using (which were buzzing speakers *insertmadface*. The sound quality seems great but I’m no electronics guru. The Creative brand has seemed pretty reliable for us in the past so I felt confident purchasing this. It’s a little bigger than I expected it to be.
customer_reviews.author: M. H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my small smart tv.
customer_reviews.text: Love the size that fits very well under my small Vizio 24" smart tv. The sound greatly improved my listening pleasure, and once I figured out how to set up the variable sound controls based on my limited configurations, I was ready to roll. My only concern was the controls to turn on and increase/decrease volume was hard to see and I had to keep turning the speaker to see and press the correct controls. I am, however, very pleased with the design and sound for such a small unit.
customer_reviews.author: chiefarchitect

customer_reviews.title: creative made something i can use?
customer_reviews.text: all three modes work. usb stick starts playing as soon as it is attached. line in works w/ [brand name] player w/ line out. bluetooth works w/ my tablets. i bought this for use w/ tablet so the auto-off does not bug me as much as it might someone else. of the many creative products i have tried last decade this is the most useful. i give it five stars b/c it does what i expected it to do after reading the product description (and specs @ creative dot com).
customer_reviews.author: DBS

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for TV usage
customer_reviews.text: Was just looking to improve the 'tinny' sound most flat panel TVs have and not create a state-of-art surround system. This product surpassed that purpose by far, especially using the subwoofer. Only quirk I've noticed is when the TV volume is low at times the volume fades away for a few seconds, but doesn't seem to happen at normal volume levels.
customer_reviews.author: cheryl

customer_reviews.title: BEST "SOUND" FOR THE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this soundbar knowing the long history of Creative Labs - as far back as 1993. This sound from the bar is on par with more expensive soundbars, like the Samsung HW-MS650 Sound+ Premium Soundbar [ I use for Home Main system]. For my home office setting, this Soundbar provides clear highs and exceptional lows [considering the flat, 8" sub], allowing for a "realistic" experience when I Skype or Zoom. I was initially considering another Samsung or perhaps Bose, but, decided to give Creative Labs Creative Stage a try, and I and glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie C

customer_reviews.title: Wired subwoofer - Not wireless
customer_reviews.text: This item description does not say wired subwoofer anywhere in the description and the wiring is not shown in the pictures so do NOT BUY if you want to have no wires showing. I would have NEVER bought a soundbar with a wired sub if I had known.
customer_reviews.author: Tony L Talbert

customer_reviews.title: It's not the quality I expected from this brand
customer_reviews.text: Creative Labs markets award winning sound and I expected such from this product. It's inexpensive for what it is so I'll keep it, and likely a bit better than others but it is not something I would recommend. I hope it's a fluke but I would avoid this product. I will not be buying any headphones from them although I understand this is not a similar good or valued good.
customer_reviews.author: Parzival

customer_reviews.title: Sound o.k.  Reliability Terrible.
customer_reviews.text: POC. Sounded good, but stopped working, for no reason, a week after I received it.
customer_reviews.author: MA

customer_reviews.title: very very good speaker
customer_reviews.text: for small speakers for computers this is second only to Logitech z305. sound quality is very close. price is excellent. the one thing that is a very minor snivel is that the z305 is a single wire and this requires 2 leads. this is the only speaker available now for any computer sound. buy it. it will enhance your computer usage.
customer_reviews.author: bilker

customer_reviews.title: High Pitched Whine
customer_reviews.text: The speaker creates an irritating high pitched whine once turned. This noise overpowers low volume music and is extremely annoying when the speaker is not in use. I would not recommend this speaker in any generally quiet space.
customer_reviews.author: NULL

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, excellent sound for Computer or Home entertainment.
customer_reviews.text: Sound much better than USB soundbars. For the best sound quality, the subwoofer should be placed with the speaker facing out to the room, and the port should be away from a wall. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Zon User

customer_reviews.title: Works great with a large monitor
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect option when you have a large monitor. No more reaching around my 28" monitor. Sounds great for the price. More expensive options sound better but I sit close to the speaker so I do not notice much of a difference. Having a remote for my computer speakers is nice.
customer_reviews.author: pdidly34

customer_reviews.title: Really good
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I bought this for my small cabin and didn't want to spend a lot. This thing is great. Great bass, multiple EQ settings and loud when I use it with my phone. Also great with the TV. I am now considering one for my college daughter for Christmas. If you need value and performance then this will be great for you. I have a huge home theater and feel like I am a discriminating audiophile. Hope this review helps others who are looking to get something without spending much.
customer_reviews.author: Toms, Bucks and Lunkers

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup and Sounds Great!
customer_reviews.text: Took about 4 minutes to unbox and setup, sounds amazing for the price, I also have Ediier R1850DB's and a Bose Sound Bar 500, and honestly I am still super impressed with the Creative Stage, you will not find anything that sounds better in this price range!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cerquoni

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Hooked up to my TV set and bum – I’m all set with very decent sound for my favorite shows and movies from Amazon Video and Netflix. I couldn’t believe that I have limited myself for so long with “integrated audio” – major upgrade, for so little price is just amazing!!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve G

customer_reviews.title: sound level cutoff due to volume and consistency
customer_reviews.text: First off these speakers have really great sound. They are great for gaming music and whatever. The only issue I have, which is a pretty big issue to me, is the ERP regulations regarding its settings. The sound literally mutes when It does not detect enough transmittal. Its not within minutes of detection, its seconds. So watching a video with minor peaks and valleys in the amount of sound being produced you will constantly hear the cutoff. If you watch or listen to anything at high volume you wont notice. But I like watching and listening with it attached to my computer and not at a level my neighbors can also listen too.
customer_reviews.author: Hole fewds

customer_reviews.title: Love this soundbar
customer_reviews.text: I'm no audiophile, but I think this sounds great. Cannot believe I went all these years without. So much better than my TV speakers-- especially love the base. Setup was easy. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Greene

customer_reviews.title: Nice Computer Speaker ~ Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this product. Easy to use and sound quality is perfect for my office space. The only caveat is that there should be a function that automatically shuts it off/standby when PC is in sleep mode. The light stays on which I know is not a big deal, but its kinda annoying. Good product otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Charles A. Johnson, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: button placement is not great
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure who at Creative thought it was a good idea to put the power on/bluetooth button next to the volume buttons, but that layout is honestly stupid. how about power/bluetooth on one side and volume buttons on the other? I'd also like some kind of visual feedback that shows level of volume. Other than that not bad. Sound is clear and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: steve m-g

customer_reviews.title: I like it, but...
customer_reviews.text: It sounds good but I cannot, for some reason, get my wife's Samsung Galaxy to connect. My iPhone 6S connected just fine and my newer iPhone XR connects just fine. I don't know if the issue is with Samsung or Creative but that part really annoys me.
customer_reviews.author: AMHepworth

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound!
customer_reviews.text: For $97 this was an amazing buy! I wanted something to enhance our TV sound, but did not want to spend a lot. Especially being in an apartment. The sound and quality of the sound blew me away! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impressive sound
customer_reviews.text: Relative to just about any TV's internal speakers. This is an economical way to reach a much better level of sound experience. We have choices for Music, Cinema, Concert, and Gaming profiles, each distinct, and none for Talking Heads (newsreaders). I'm still not decided as to which of the options works best for that. Nevertheless, I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: F. Sheffield

customer_reviews.title: Get it. It’s worth it you won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. It has really good sound quality great highs and bass. I use it for gaming but while listening to music on it it sounds really good. I was worried with the negative reviews on here but they are expecting something outrageous. I would by this again and again if need. Also the sound is better than my Samsung sound bars I have.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This unit sounds decent. Highs are reasonably crisp. Could use a little deeper bass. Overall just fine for what it is. Only thing I'm a little disappointed with is that it doesn't get very loud. You really have to crank it up if there is much ambient noise or if you're on video conference and the others are quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth outside in hammock!
customer_reviews.text: We used this in our vehicle on a road trip and also way out in the country on a farm as we lay in hammocks in the trees listening to an Amazon Audible book together. Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: donna

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The first few days it was fine. But it continually disconnects itself from the tv. It forces me daily to either unplug and plug in the hdmi plug to get the unit to work, or to shut the unit off completely to reset it. I will be replacing it as soon as i have the money. Not happy at all
customer_reviews.author: margent7

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Sound!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace my Creative ROAR SR20A. It's not quite as nice as the ROAR SR20A, but it's darned close. I found a 5VDC 2A AC/DC Adapter works perfectly with the Creative Stage Air sound bar to power the unit and charge the batteries. Whether music, straight voice, or gaming, this is hard to beat. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: For the rating it got on CNET thought it would sound better with more crisp sound but it wasn’t. July 2020 it is not working properly and getting it replaced via Creative is a huge problem. Save yourself a headache buy a soundbar from a box store as buying it from 2nd party like amazon is creating a huge issue!
customer_reviews.author: Eli Azzo

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre at Best
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the subwoofer, and wish I would have gone another direction. The bass in this system is INCREDIBLY OVERWHELMING, even when turning it to -5. If you are looking for a flat/accurate sounds stage, this is NOT the way to go. It's muddy in the mids, and the subwoofer is completely overpowering the system. This makes dialogue nearly impossible to hear clearly, and has me reaching for the remote everytime something changes between dialogue/action/etc. Worse there is no way to adjust the volume of the sub independently. It's a step up from my TV's rear speaker, but definitely not worth the pricetag.
customer_reviews.author: Brian s.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome setup for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Great speak system for the price. Love the sound and boom of the bass when playing games. Had to make feet to lift it up to clear my monitor stand. Other than that no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: cwthoma

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great sound, annoying LED light.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - great value - great sound - great sub - smaller and stronger than most sound bars at similar price point - Supports ARC Cons: - annoying LED lights when turned off. I use this in the bedroom and the LED is so bright that makes it hard to sleep. Had to move the sound bar to the living room. - 2.1 only.
customer_reviews.author: Tofu King Good

customer_reviews.title: Used to love Creative, but this is garbage
customer_reviews.text: It constantly starts humming and cuts out sound. The buttons on the side are hard to feel, you have to look at them. It doesn't sound any better than a cheap desktop 2.1 speaker setup.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking and versatile.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a good Logitech 2.1 system that had a faulty on/off switch. This doesn't sound as good as that, but it takes less space and fits really well on my desktop. I also like the remote control which simplifies changing settings. The sound quality as I said is not awesome(it seems a little thin) but it is very good for the price. It's definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: T. Sorensen

customer_reviews.title: Like all bluetooth or wireless devices they have audio delay!
customer_reviews.text: Overall this fits exactly what I wanted it for, and for the price you can't beat it. However for gaming, not so much there is at least a good solid 2~4 millisecond delay in the audio, when testing it. It's not massive, but it's enough to mess up some rhythm games such as Osu! for example and make playing it very difficult. Otherthan that, very nice buy!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Hamblin

customer_reviews.title: Customer support should be improved
customer_reviews.text: Well it stopped working after 2 months. Contacted support and told me after doing what they told me still did not work. So they said send it back. So before I did that,I disconnected the system and plug it in and bingo. It worked..Just goes to show you the old ways shut it down and reboot.
customer_reviews.author: brian m

customer_reviews.title: On/Off Issues
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this sound bar when it works - the sound quality is nice for the money and the sound bar is a fantastic size! Unfortunately, since purchase the power button only works half the time and it takes a good 10-15sec of continuous clicking/holding to turn the unit on. Not sure if it is a problem specific to the unit I have or is across the board. It also has a hard time holding a charge if I leave it sitting and then try to use it without recharging from the wall. I wish it was more user friendly to turn on so I could actually enjoy it!
customer_reviews.author: Jules Jokela

customer_reviews.title: Works good and sounds good
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is an excellent sound bar. The only thing I would add is a subwoofer that I could purchase separately. I like base you can feel. My wife loves it as is.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Sears

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great!
customer_reviews.text: Very simple set up. The sound is a drastic improvement over the tinny speakers in my TV. The subwoofer adds a very nice extra rumble on the low notes. The sound bar itself has an aesthetic design that doesn't detract from my decor.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.

customer_reviews.title: Sound is OK but UI is a fail
customer_reviews.text: I hate that it disconnects frequently then quite loudly says “waiting for device to connect” every time you start off a new connection. As far as I can tell you can’t turn this off. This is VERY annoying, so much so that I’ll probably stop using this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Vegemite

customer_reviews.title: Short lived
customer_reviews.text: Day one: Excitement quickly turned into disappointment as the Bluetooth sound started to cut off periodically regardless of phone distance to speaker. Tried sound from the computer with the provided 3.5mm cable. No sound cut off, quality decent for the price. Day two: No sound, dead. LED comes on but no audio. They say you get what you pay for, this time, not even that. Sending back.
customer_reviews.author: Mariana Chacon

customer_reviews.title: Compact and attractive design - no bass
customer_reviews.text: The Creative Stage without the sub-woofer is an attractive design for under monitor sound. However; if you purchase this without the sub-woofer, don't expect much in the way of bass. I haven't tried the sub-woofer that is now available.
customer_reviews.author: LLcdPH

customer_reviews.title: Great sound in small portable package
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Creative Stage Air Portable and Compact Under-Monitor USB-Powered Soundbar for Computer, with Dual-Driver to be used as under monitor speakers hardwired. They work great. I plug in the headphone adapter and USB (fro power) from monitor to speakers. I had to update the firmware so that my speakers wouldn't turn off after 15 minutes, but a simple download from Creative.com put onto a USB flash drive and it updated easily. Now it shuts off after 6 hours. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix125

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Works well for my WFH work station. The only suggestion I have is I wish the included 3.5mm cable was longer.
customer_reviews.author: Super Geek

customer_reviews.title: Product Problems.
customer_reviews.text: Notice. Product problems. 1. Does not come with power supply. Need 5 v. 2 amp. Micro to USB A. 2. Power processing by unit problematic. Unit turns itself off and has to be restarted. 3. Green led lights front & back - especially front, are exceptionally bright. Lights up entire bedroom at night. 4. Don't try to email customer support. Set up solely for non-US citizens. 5. Customer chat offline. 6. Do not recommend for TV or monitor. Only small incremental improvement in sound quality. Returning unit to Amazon for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Customer since 2000

customer_reviews.title: Good value but sound quality lacks a bit
customer_reviews.text: This fits nice under my monitor without taking up to much space. The sound quality OK but not hi fidelity. Using Windows 10 Dolby or DTS improves the quality. DTS especially adds a more full sound.
customer_reviews.author: Merc

customer_reviews.title: Awesome soundbar
customer_reviews.text: I like it very much compared to those expensive soundbar this creative stage has a good sound quality, not expensive, and value for money
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers
customer_reviews.text: I love these speakers this is exactly what I was looking for at the perfect price point something compact that fits under my monitor and has optical input. I only have one complaint though, the tactile feel from the buttons on the right of the speaker are the most awful cheep feeling buttons I've ever pushed in my life (petty, I know). The button feel reminds of the bubble button from the trouble board game.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Connecting to Samsung TV via HDMI-ARC will not work
customer_reviews.text: This soundbar will not work with HDMI-ARC connection even my Samsung 6 series TV and Soundbar both have HDMI-ARC port. When you unhook all the cables and change the TV setting to HDMI-ARC it works but after turning the TV off and turning it back on, it looses connection! On your TV screen it shows connecting to Anynet+ (HDMI-CEC) and after few minutes the HDMI connection option disappears from TV menu and sound comes out of TV speakers. I connected TV with Optical cable to the soundbar and it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes it freezes when connected via ARC
customer_reviews.text: I have a TCL roku smart tv connected via hdmi ARC to the soundbar and it works great, however sometimes (not very frequent) it freezes and I have to unplug the soundbar from the electrical current to reset it... It is very annoying, would give 5 stars if not were for this issue. Excellent sound quality for the price, and a great audio upgrade for any cheap tv.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: Came on time and sound better than the monitor speaker. The bluetooth work well, I was able to pair with my phone when I needed. Overall, I got a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Chiadog

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: A nice setup for PC. The mids are the strongest on this setup from the soundbar. The bass from the sub does decent lows but don’t expect this system to wow an audio enthusiast. However, for the money I’m very pleased and it does provide an excellent audio solution for daily use for watching videos and gaming. For $80 I think the system delivers a nice PC sound system.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cannot beat for the money
customer_reviews.text: Sound is really great. Deep bass, brings movies and shows to life. I will say that it is in a smallish room, so let that be your guide. I would have given 5 stars in a hot minute if I could have synced the remote with EITHER my TV or my cable remotes. I hate having to use 3 remotes, I mean, what year is this?? . That's the ONLY bad thing i can say about it to be honest.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Delellis

customer_reviews.title: Odd hissing noise
customer_reviews.text: Sounds good, but has a hissing noise in the background.
customer_reviews.author: Mack-SS-Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Sound
customer_reviews.text: Quality sound. Can't beat it for the price. My wife even thought the TV was even looking better.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Feliciano

customer_reviews.title: Save your money, skip the headaches!
customer_reviews.text: This unit has this neat feature where it turns it self off when it does not receive a loud enough input signal. It shuts itself during subtle dialog and then it only works half the time to turn itself back on. I know the speakers have turned off since they emit a very audible hiss when they are actually on. The hiss is SO LOUD on this thing its disgusting, you know its on! And last but not least the IR remote actually mixed signals with my RGB LEDS and every time i change the volume up or down my LEDS change! This unit is a total waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Ridsdale

customer_reviews.title: No directions for installing
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to enhance the sound of our Sony TV. There was only a poor graphic representation of how to set up the sound bar. We also went to the website and there was nothing of value there either. We set it up according to the directions but never got sound. We adjusted the TV settings several times and no sound. Finally gave up and returned the product.
customer_reviews.author: Leanne K. Peters

customer_reviews.title: For what I paid for this, it's great.
customer_reviews.text: As others have mentioned, it's definitely bass heavy (which I don't mind at all), but the sound is good. If you're looking for something more evened out, I wouldn't recommend it, but if you like the bass to be a bit heavier, then these are great.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this soundbar and sub for my office and it is all and more than what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality, but annoying LED
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Creative Stage 2.1 set to use as my desktop speakers. They sound great, rivaling more expensive TV sound bars at half the price. The LED panel on the other hand, is extremely bright and stays on forever, which is why I can't give this product a 5 star review. I had to hide the soundbar behind my monitor for it to not be so blinding.
customer_reviews.author: David Y.

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Value for money is EXCELLENT I was skeptical, but I was surprised by the quality of sound and how easy it fits under the monitor Great job by Creative 👍
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed Abdul-Aziz

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Had always wanted a soundbar with a sub-woofer for my bedroom TV and this is perfect. Not too big and super easy to use/setup and sounds superb. The bass is house rattling and and all the settings available with the remote are great.
customer_reviews.author: crazyeyes98

customer_reviews.title: No Comment its creative company
customer_reviews.text: The first i need give big thanks for creative sound bar because it's relay amazing for everything like movies and games and music compare for price so if anyone need my advice by this model with sub woofer and thank you for amazon for support shipping to Saudi Arabia its very fast delivery just in one week
customer_reviews.author: AmrElGamal

customer_reviews.title: NICE DESIGN, SHORT BATTERY LIFE
customer_reviews.text: I like the design; the bar is elegant & easy to place. The sound quality is good but the biggest problem is the very short battery life. Also, extremely annoying is the voice that makes useless & incomprehsible statements every time you plug in or charge or turn on the sound.
customer_reviews.author: Lightning

customer_reviews.title: Problems connecting to Sony TV and Verizon FiOS DVR
customer_reviews.text: I have been unable to get audio with my Sony KDL-46EX400 TV set and Verizon FiOS DVR. Optical from TV, Optical from Cable box, HDMI from TV, HDMI from TV and Optical from TV, HDMI from TV and Optical from Cable box, Audio from TV, Audio from cable box, Audio from TV and Optical from TV, Audio from Cable box and Optical from Cable box, Audio from TV and HDMI from TV. Nothing worked. Any suggestions?
customer_reviews.author: Richard B.

product_meta.title: Creative Stage 2.1 Channel Under-Monitor Soundbar with Subwoofer for TV, Computers, and Ultrawide Monitors, Bluetooth/Optical Input/TV ARC/AUX-in, Remote Control and Wall Mounting Kit
feature_bullets: CLUTTER-FREE, UNDER-MONITOR SOUNDBAR FOR COMPUTER AND TV | Fits perfectly under a PC monitor and blends naturally into any room interior with its sleek, subtle design. The soundbar also comes with a wall mounting kit that allows you to install the Creative Stage easily onto your wall with included instructions and hardware. The soundbar is conveniently powered by a single built-in power plug, providing you with a clutter-free desktop and TV console – just connect it to a power source and you’re

DUAL-DRIVERS WITH SUBWOOFER FOR ROOM-FILLING AUDIO | This high performing 2.1 speaker system produces 160W peak power and houses two custom-tuned, mid-range drivers for enhanced dialog clarity and stunning mid-range. Paired with a long throw dedicated subwoofer, the Creative Stage is capable of deep, thumping bass that will captivate you in the immersiveness of your movies and music in any room size

CONVENIENT CONTROLS WITH REMOTE | Controls are conveniently located at the side of the soundbar for easy reach and hassle-free control. For added convenience, there is an included remote control that allows you to access preset EQ selections like movies, music, concert, and even gaming mode! Apart from the usual audio and volume playback controls, the remote also allows you the ability to increase and reduce treble and bass settings

VARIOUS CONNECTIVITY OPTIONS | Conveniently connect your TV, PC/Mac, and mobile phones through our myriad of connectivity options such as wireless Bluetooth, 3.5mm AUX-in, Optical Audio input, TV (ARC), and USB MP3. These extensive soundbar connections make it an easy choice for any audio upgrade
USB MP3 | Doubles up as a standalone music player via a mass storage device without turning on the TV or other external inputs

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars471 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
